issue.title: Local Cloudsim hangs up on comms broker

content.raw: Is the `X1` that was spawned in the staging area?  Do you have ROS connectivity on all of those IPs and ports?  `Starting SubT comms broker` may hang if your network configuration is incorrect.
content.html: Is the X1 that was spawned in the staging area? Do you have ROS connectivity on all of those IPs and ports? Starting SubT comms broker may hang if your network configuration is incorrect.

content.html: Is there anything else than docker_compose.yaml (listed above) I have to do to assure proper network setup?

issue.title: Local Cloudsim hangs up on comms broker

content.raw:
Looking at the log of my submission to SubT Challenge Portal, it seems that my Docker image modification is still running original testbed code, not mine. Can you see anything wrong with this Dockerfile:

```
FROM osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:subt_solution_latest

COPY docker ~/subt_ws/install/share
CMD ~/subt_ws/install/share/run_sim.bash
```

‌
content.html:
Looking at the log of my submission to SubT Challenge Portal, it seems that my Docker image modification is still running original testbed code, not mine. Can you see anything wrong with this Dockerfile:

FROM osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:subt_solution_latest

COPY docker ~/subt_ws/install/share
CMD ~/subt_ws/install/share/run_sim.bash

‌

issue.title: Local Cloudsim hangs up on comms broker

content.raw:
Please reference some of the examples from the [subt_hello_world](https://bitbucket.org/jgrogers/subt_hello_world/src/development/docker/) repository.

When the Docker image is run on CloudSim, it references the `ENTRYPOINT`.  It does not appear you have an `ENTRYPOINT` set from above:

Example:
```
FROM osrf/subt-virtual-testbed
...
COPY docker/helloworld_submit/run_sim.sh ./run_sim.sh
ENTRYPOINT ["./run_sim.sh"]
```

Where `run_sim.sh` is a file containing:
```

#!/usr/bin/env bash

. /opt/ros/melodic/setup.bash
. ~/subt_ws/install/setup.sh
. ~/workspaces/catkin_build_ws/devel/setup.bash

exec roslaunch helloworld_subt_launch robot.launch name:=alpha other_robot:=bravo perception:=true comms:=false control:=true fake_report:=false
```
content.html:
Please reference some of the examples from the subt_hello_world repository.

When the Docker image is run on CloudSim, it references the ENTRYPOINT. It does not appear you have an ENTRYPOINT set from above:

Example:

FROM osrf/subt-virtual-testbed
...
COPY docker/helloworld_submit/run_sim.sh ./run_sim.sh
ENTRYPOINT ["./run_sim.sh"]

Where run_sim.sh is a file containing:

#!/usr/bin/env bash

. /opt/ros/melodic/setup.bash
. ~/subt_ws/install/setup.sh
. ~/workspaces/catkin_build_ws/devel/setup.bash

exec roslaunch helloworld_subt_launch robot.launch name:=alpha other_robot:=bravo perception:=true comms:=false control:=true fake_report:=false

issue.title: Local Cloudsim hangs up on comms broker

content.raw: AFAIK, the last `CMD` with parameters overrides the `ENTRYPOINT`
content.html: AFAIK, the last CMD with parameters overrides the ENTRYPOINT

issue.title: Local Cloudsim hangs up on comms broker

content.raw: @Arthur I’m getting `starting container process caused "exec: "./entrypoint.sh": permission denied` error when using your example.
content.html: @Arthur I’m getting starting container process caused "exec: "./entrypoint.sh": permission denied error when using your example.

issue.title: Local Cloudsim hangs up on comms broker

content.raw:
Sounds like a file permissions error, `chown` or `chmod` the file.  The `subt_hello_world` example is linked on this page: #!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials

I also recommend checking the `wiki` on that `subt_hello_world` repository.
content.html:
Sounds like a file permissions error, chown or chmod the file. The subt_hello_world example is linked on this page: #!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials

I also recommend checking the wiki on that subt_hello_world repository.

issue.title: Local Cloudsim hangs up on comms broker

content.raw:
The final status of CloudSim is that my Docker image runs fine and scores on SubT Challenge servers, but doesn’t run on any of my PCs. Catkin build always runs reliably. 

On the first PC \(weak GPU\) with fresh OS and ignition, simulation hangs up here:

```
sim_1        | [Msg] Unloaded level [23]
sim_1        | [Msg] Unloaded level [24]
sim_1        | [Msg] Unloaded level [25]
sim_1        | [Msg] Unloaded level [34]
sim_1        | [Msg] Unloaded level [35]
sim_1        | [Msg] Unloaded level [39]
```

On the second PC, it crashes here:

```
sim_1        | [Dbg] [CommsBrokerPlugin.cc:115] Loading radio_config from SDF: 
sim_1        | Radio Configuration
sim_1        | -- capacity: 1e+06
sim_1        | -- default_tx_power: 20
sim_1        | -- noise_floor: -90
sim_1        | -- modulation: QPSK
sim_1        | 
sim_1        | [Dbg] [SimulationFeatures.cc:47] Simulation timestep set to: 0.004
sim_1        | [Msg] Serving scene information on [/world/urban_qual/scene/info]
sim_1        | [Msg] Serving graph information on [/world/urban_qual/scene/graph]
sim_1        | [Msg] Serving full state on [/world/urban_qual/state]
sim_1        | [Msg] Publishing scene information on [/world/urban_qual/scene/info]
sim_1        | [Msg] Publishing entity deletions on [/world/urban_qual/scene/deletion]
sim_1        | [Msg] Publishing state changes on [/world/urban_qual/state]
sim_1        | [Msg] Publishing pose messages on [/world/urban_qual/pose/info]
sim_1        | [Msg] Publishing dynamic pose messages on [/world/urban_qual/dynamic_pose/info]
sim_1        | [Dbg] [CommsBrokerPlugin.cc:210] Using [visibility_range] comms model
sim_1        | [Msg] Starting SubT comms broker
sim_1        | [Dbg] [Manager.cc:782] [[Err] [GameLogicPlugin.cc:988] [GameLogicPlugin]: Unable to find robot with name [X1]. Ignoring PoseFromArtifact request
^CGracefully stopping... (press Ctrl+C again to force)
Killing docker_solution1_1    ... done
Killing docker_bridge1_1      ... done
Killing docker_sim_1          ... done
```

‌

The final status of CloudSim is that my Docker image runs fine and scores on SubT Challenge servers, but doesn’t run on any of my PCs. Catkin build always runs reliably.

On the first PC (weak GPU) with fresh OS and ignition, simulation hangs up here:

issue.title: Local Cloudsim hangs up on comms broker

content.raw:
There is a [handy script](#!/osrf/subt/src/default/docker/json2docker.rb) that simplified running SubT docker images locally. Here are some steps:

1. Save an example JSON file:

```
./json2docker.rb -e > my_subt_config.json
```

2. Edit  `my_subt_config.json` according to your testing needs. The fields should be self-explanatory.

3. Run your solution using

```
./json2docker -f my_subt_config.json -e
```

4. See additional options using the `-h` command line argument.

```
./json2docker -h
```
content.html:
There is a handy script that simplified running SubT docker images locally. Here are some steps:

  1. Save an example JSON file:
./json2docker.rb -e > my_subt_config.json

  1. Edit my_subt_config.json according to your testing needs. The fields should be self-explanatory.

  2. Run your solution using

./json2docker -f my_subt_config.json -e
  1. See additional options using the -h command line argument.
./json2docker -h
